title: 16 Best Office Chairs on Amazon 2025, Including Prime Day Deals
description: From budget-friendly models to an all-around ergonomic Herman Miller option
author: Julia Harrison, Audrey Lee
excerpt: The best office chairs on Amazon include stylish, ergonomic options from Branch, Flexispot, Steelcase, and beyond. Shop Prime Day deals on some of our favorites.
text: You’re likely here because you’re tired of looking at and sitting in the same old unattractive, uncomfortable office chair every day. The best office chairs on Amazon can fix that, ranging from our favorite overall, Herman Miller’s Aeron Office Chair, to ergonomic beauties from Branch, Flexispot, and Haworth that come cosigned by AD staffers.These chairs all feature many adjustment points (like armrests, lumbar support, and seat depth), and most have high backs to support your entire spine. We looked for chairs that have plenty of cushioning, a frame that supports proper alignment, and wheels for maneuvering around your home office.And with Amazon Prime Day on the horizon, it’s never been a better time to make your office space slightly more ergonomic. We found the best Prime Day deals on desk chairs for every kind of budget and style, including some of our favorite options from the massive digital warehouse that is the Everything Store. If you need a refresher on Prime Day, we've got you covered. And be sure to check out all the other best sellers and home deals Prime Day has to offer.Our Top Picks for Office Chairs on Amazon:Best Office Chair, Overall: Herman Miller Aeron Chair, $1,530A Stylish, Streamlined Option: Branch Ergonomic Chair, $389Easiest Assembly: Haworth Breck Office Chair, $499 $464Most Lumbar Support: Vari Task Chair, $399An Internet Favorite Pick: Misolant Ergonomic Office Chair, $190 $130Best Budget Pick: Flexispot OC3B Chair, $200 $150Top picks on sale for Prime DayHaworth Breck Office ChairMisolant Ergonomic Office ChairNeo Chair Office and Gaming ChairSIHOO M18 Ergonomic Office ChairSteelcase Leap Office ChairAmazon Basics Low-Back Mesh Desk ChairHaworth Soji Office ChairIf you're interested in Haworth's Breck chair (a top pick that's also on sale for Prime Day), but not a fan of the open weave design, the brand's Soji chair features an equally breathable tight-weave mesh back. Like the Breck, the streamlined Soji has 4-D armrests and an adjustable back that makes it easy to create customized lumbar support. It's also available in unexpected colorways like a juniper-inspired green and ocean blue to add some personality to what can feel like an otherwise sterile desk setup.Serta Mia Modern Office ChairIn addition to its trusted mattress offerings, Serta also makes office furniture. This height adjustable velvet chair has memory foam padding in the seat and arms, and a wheeled base with 360-degree casters. “It doesn't rock, so it helps me so much from slouching,” one reviewer writes, while another commends its “great back support.”Brenton Studio Realspace Jancy Office ChairThis low-back task chair won't overwhelm small desks thanks to its petite silhouette. You'll miss out on some of the bells and whistles higher ticket items on this list might provide—the only points of adjustment are seat height and a lockable tilt mechanism—but the sleek-looking chrome base has a sophisticated feel and the design will have no problem tucking neatly under a table or desktop.Sweetcrispy Ergonomic Mesh Office ChairProducts that will help you maintain proper posture are always with the splurge. Anyone spending long stretches of time working at home will benefit from this on-sale pick from Sweetcrispy. The headrest design supports increased spinal alignment while the mesh lumbar back rest can be adjusted up and down to target specific pain points.Dumos Home Office Desk Chair with FootrestAn office chair with a retractable footrest? We’re sold. You may have noticed that desk chairs with built-in footrests are all the rage on TikTok and this office-slash-gaming chair also features additional lumbar support, a removable lumbar pillow, and an ergonomic, padded seat. We appreciate the head rest too, which makes this a great reading chair option you'll be able to comfortably curl up in.Amazon Basics Office ChairHere’s a sturdy option that’s just over 30% off right now from Amazon Basics. It’s got all the things you'd want from an office chair: maximum cushioning, several adjustments, and a tilt mechanism to keep you comfortable throughout your day. It's also under $100, which we'll point out is a rare deal for a chair with so many points of adjustability.Best Office Chair on Amazon, OverallHerman Miller Aeron Chair“The iconic [Aeron] is truly supportive and gives you every bit of adjustment to sit in an ideal way,” senior digital design editor Zoë Sessums said in her review of the legendary Herman Miller office chair. While buyers shopping through Herman Miller can experience a virtual fitting with an ergonomic expert, the Amazon experience is perfect for someone who knows what they want and offers speedy delivery to Prime members looking to upgrade their office setup in a jiffy. Stand-out features Sessums noted includes the patented PostureFit SL back support, which facilitated optimal working posture: chest open, shoulders back, and pelvis tilted slightly forward. “This chair will save your body. It isn’t necessarily the chicest piece of furniture, but your entire body will thank you, so in that case I would recommend the Aeron chair again and again,” says Sessums.A Stylish, Streamlined OptionBranch Ergonomic ChairOur contributor Terri Williams once told us that this Branch office chair “looks as good as it feels.” And we think it looks pretty great with its clean lines that give the design a streamlined look. Williams also praised the chair for its slim profile, synchronous tilt, and adjustable lumbar support that make the seat suitable for long working hours. If you’re in the market for an upgrade, the more advanced Branch Ergonomic Chair Pro received high praise from the AD shopping team for its adjustability and looks. (However, you’ll have to buy directly through Branch’s website for that model.)Easiest AssemblyHaworth Breck Office ChairThe Breck chair’s easy assembly and breathable upholstery make it a top-tier choice for building an optimal home office. “What stands out the most to me are all the adjustable features that allow you to customize the seat to your exact preferences,” says commerce editor Audrey Lee. “Need more tilt? No problem. Wish the armrests were just a tad longer? Easy. Height? Seat depth? Lumbar support? Done, done, and done.” Stylistically, the chair has a minimal look, but it’s available in unexpected colorways like an agave-inspired green and blush pink to add some personality to what can feel like an otherwise sterile desk accessory.Most Lumbar SupportVari Task ChairThis Vari design is another model you might recognize from our main list of the best ergonomic office chairs. “This chair is ridiculously comfortable—it has a super-thick foam seat and highly breathable back with great airflow,” Williams says. “The backrest provides lumbar support and I like that I can also create the maximum level of comfort.” The chair is also equipped with an adjustable tilt mechanism, adjustable armrests, and adjustable seat height that can be set to your specific preference. We also recommend checking out their suburb lineup of standing desks that can fit home offices of all sizes.An Internet Favorite PickMisolant Ergonomic Office ChairA hidden footrest gives this TikTok-famous pick some star quality. Reviewers say that the chair has great back support and appreciate the design is easy to assemble. At under $150, it’s also a great budget option for anyone looking to experiment with finding the right seating situation for work from home days.Best Budget PickFlexispot OC3B ChairFlexispot’s OC3B is one of our favorite desk chairs sold on Amazon. According to AD tester Terri Williams, it’s the “best of both worlds” when it comes to comfort and price point. “The entire chair (backrest, seat, headrest) is made of breathable mesh, which contributes to air circulation,” she writes, and it has “several adjustment points, plus a clothes hanger on the back to keep a jacket or throw blanket close by.” To top it all off, it’s just plain comfortable for sitting in hour after hour. Though you are trying to take more breaks, right?More Office Chairs We RecommendNeo Chair Office and Gaming ChairFor those who want comfort but find themselves on a tight budget, here’s a supportive, under-$75 option that’ll arrive in just two days. A breathable mesh design means you won’t get sweaty while plowing through spreadsheets or fighting digital enemies, and the 15-minute assembly process isn’t bad either.SIHOO M18 Ergonomic Office ChairSihoo’s popular ergonomic mesh office chair combines affordability and quality. You’ll get a padded headrest, adjustable lumbar support, and a contoured cushion—all with a lifetime warranty. Reviewers say this is an especially great pick for “big and tall” folks, since you can adjust the seat and headrest heights a great deal and the seat itself is roomy.Branch Verve ChairBranch makes high-quality, comfortable office chairs at middle-of-the-road price points. An adjustable lumbar rest and a contoured backrest will help keep you feeling fresh, even if you’re stuck at your desk for hours. Not only does this chair swivel, it tilts, it’s height-adjustable, and you can tweak the seat depth.Branch Daily ChairThe Daily Chair is a Goldilocks office chair that has everything you need (adjustable height and armrests, plush cushions, and easy-to-maneuver wheels) and nothing you don’t. It offers plenty of spinal and lumbar support for long hours perched at your desk, plus it comes in pleasing hues like mahogany and sky blue besides your standard neutral gray and black.Steelcase Gesture Office ChairThe Steelcase Gesture may be quite expensive for an office chair—$1,600 is no small chunk of change—but if you’re looking to splurge on one of the most comfortable chairs you’ll ever sit in, it’s absolutely worth the price. The Gesture strikes the perfect balance between plush and firm, providing back support for long days at your desk alongside a thick, comfortable seat that holds up to years of punishment. There are three recline positions to let you fine-tune your position throughout the day, and the intuitive adjustment mechanisms make it easy to move things around without any fuss.Steelcase Series 1 Office ChairThe Steelcase Series 1 uses your body weight to automatically adjust back and lumbar support when you sit down, meaning you don’t have to fuss with buttons or levers to get the right fit, something we have found to be tricky with cheaper chairs. The Series 1 is also wildly customizable, with the option to add a headrest, your choice of carpet or hardwood wheels, and seemingly endless color options (such as neon orange and lemon yellow) for the maximalist home office. No matter what type of space you’re working with, there’s a Series 1 we think will work for you.Herman Miller Embody Ergonomic Office ChairIt’s not entirely surprising that the midcentury specialists at Herman Miller have optimized an all-around ergonomic office chair, the Embody. The tapered back panel takes cues from the human body, with a central spine to keep things stable and flexible ribs for comfort. In fact, the brand collaborated with over 20 physicians and doctors in biomechanics, vision, physical therapy, and ergonomics to perfect this chair.Steelcase Leap Office ChairThanks to 3D LiveBack technology, Steelcase’s Leap can align itself to the shape of your spine, using seven points of adjustment to perfectly cradle your back during long days parked in front of the screen. The Natural Glide seat moves forward and back as you recline, keeping you in the optimal seated position whether you’re trying to relax or want to sit up straight and dig in.Zesthouse Modern Cane Office ChairIf you haven’t yet scored a vintage Breuer model, here’s a cane-back office chair in a similar midcentury style. The seat is topped with a tufted, faux-leather cushion, which one reviewer describes as “thick,” “not too shiny,” and “luxurious.” (And unlike genuine leather, it’ll be easy to keep clean.)Amazon Basics Low-Back Mesh Desk ChairNot everyone is a fan of armchairs—sometimes they actually just get in the way. If you really want to get back to basics, here’s an option from the retailer itself—that just may be the most-reviewed office chair on the site. The two-inch-thick seat cushion will provide ample support, and the contoured mesh back will bend to your weight, unlike rigid models made from leather or upholstery. (If you’re not yet persuaded, you could always read some of the nearly 14,000 five-star reviews.)FAQsWhy is it important to get a high-quality office chair?A high-quality chair will pay for itself in a handful of ways. First, it’ll last longer than ones that are constructed poorly, in the hopes that you’ll be able to use it for years and years before replacing. Second, high-quality chairs usually have more cushioning, more thoughtful construction, and more points of adjustment—all of which are important for your physical health, especially if you plan on sitting on your task chair for eight hours a day. “A proper fitting desk chair is one of the cornerstones of postural health,” neurosurgeon Betsy Grunch, MD, FAANS, FACS previously told Clever. “People who sit for long hours in a poorly adjusted chair will experience neck, back, shoulder, and hip pain. This can trigger headaches, lack of concentration and compression of the discs in the spine.”What does “ergonomic” even mean?You’ve definitely heard of the word ergonomic, but it can be tough figuring out exactly what that means for your home office chairs. “A chair that is coined ergonomic should offer firmness that is supportive yet comfortable,” Kristy Basinger PT, CHT, previously told us. “It should have multiple components that adjust all aspects of the chair. Adjustments are important because we all have different body types and heights.” Using adjustable components so that your chair fits your body (and not the other way around) keeps your spine in a healthy position, which reduces the risk of hurting your back or neck.What should you look for in an office chair?Every chair feels a little bit different for every single person. There are a few things to keep in mind when you’re looking for a comfy chair that isn’t going to cause you any pain now or in the future.Look for something adjustable: The beauty here is that you have some literal wiggle room if something feels a bit off. Set yourself up for success by looking into options with an adjustable headrest, adjustable armrests, a seat height with a bit of range, etc.Pay close attention to where there is support: Some chairs have fuller seat cushions made of a high-density material and others offer a bit of recline. You know your body best, so take the time to figure out where your pain areas are and where you need an extra bit of support. In general, chairs with lumbar support are always a good place to start.Check the warranty and return policy: In general, furniture items shipped by Amazon (or that are Prime eligible) are returnable for any reason within 30 days of receipt of shipment. This especially comes in handy when you’re buying a desk chair sight unseen. (Some items that aren’t shipped by Amazon may be subject to the vendor’s own return policy, so be sure to read the fine print.) If you’re worried about durability, most vendors offer free warranties—meaning they’ll replace your chair if it falls apart—even several years after your purchase.
html:
You’re likely here because you’re tired of looking at and sitting in the same old unattractive, uncomfortable office chair every day. The best office chairs on Amazon can fix that, ranging from our favorite overall, Herman Miller’s Aeron Office Chair, to ergonomic beauties from Branch, Flexispot, and Haworth that come cosigned by AD staffers.

These chairs all feature many adjustment points (like armrests, lumbar support, and seat depth), and most have high backs to support your entire spine. We looked for chairs that have plenty of cushioning, a frame that supports proper alignment, and wheels for maneuvering around your home office.

And with Amazon Prime Day on the horizon, it’s never been a better time to make your office space slightly more ergonomic. We found the best Prime Day deals on desk chairs for every kind of budget and style, including some of our favorite options from the massive digital warehouse that is the Everything Store. If you need a refresher on Prime Day, we've got you covered. And be sure to check out all the other best sellers and home deals Prime Day has to offer.

Our Top Picks for Office Chairs on Amazon:

  • Best Office Chair, Overall: Herman Miller Aeron Chair, $1,530
  • A Stylish, Streamlined Option: Branch Ergonomic Chair, $389
  • Easiest Assembly: Haworth Breck Office Chair, $499 $464
  • Most Lumbar Support: Vari Task Chair, $399
  • An Internet Favorite Pick: Misolant Ergonomic Office Chair, $190 $130
  • Best Budget Pick: Flexispot OC3B Chair, $200 $150

Top picks on sale for Prime Day

Haworth Breck Office Chair

Misolant Ergonomic Office Chair

Neo Chair Office and Gaming Chair

SIHOO M18 Ergonomic Office Chair

Steelcase Leap Office Chair

Amazon Basics Low-Back Mesh Desk Chair

Haworth Soji Office Chair

If you're interested in Haworth's Breck chair (a top pick that's also on sale for Prime Day), but not a fan of the open weave design, the brand's Soji chair features an equally breathable tight-weave mesh back. Like the Breck, the streamlined Soji has 4-D armrests and an adjustable back that makes it easy to create customized lumbar support. It's also available in unexpected colorways like a juniper-inspired green and ocean blue to add some personality to what can feel like an otherwise sterile desk setup.

Serta Mia Modern Office Chair

In addition to its trusted mattress offerings, Serta also makes office furniture. This height adjustable velvet chair has memory foam padding in the seat and arms, and a wheeled base with 360-degree casters. “It doesn't rock, so it helps me so much from slouching,” one reviewer writes, while another commends its “great back support.”

Brenton Studio Realspace Jancy Office Chair

This low-back task chair won't overwhelm small desks thanks to its petite silhouette. You'll miss out on some of the bells and whistles higher ticket items on this list might provide—the only points of adjustment are seat height and a lockable tilt mechanism—but the sleek-looking chrome base has a sophisticated feel and the design will have no problem tucking neatly under a table or desktop.

Sweetcrispy Ergonomic Mesh Office Chair

Products that will help you maintain proper posture are always with the splurge. Anyone spending long stretches of time working at home will benefit from this on-sale pick from Sweetcrispy. The headrest design supports increased spinal alignment while the mesh lumbar back rest can be adjusted up and down to target specific pain points.

Dumos Home Office Desk Chair with Footrest

An office chair with a retractable footrest? We’re sold. You may have noticed that desk chairs with built-in footrests are all the rage on TikTok and this office-slash-gaming chair also features additional lumbar support, a removable lumbar pillow, and an ergonomic, padded seat. We appreciate the head rest too, which makes this a great reading chair option you'll be able to comfortably curl up in.

Amazon Basics Office Chair

Here’s a sturdy option that’s just over 30% off right now from Amazon Basics. It’s got all the things you'd want from an office chair: maximum cushioning, several adjustments, and a tilt mechanism to keep you comfortable throughout your day. It's also under $100, which we'll point out is a rare deal for a chair with so many points of adjustability.

Best Office Chair on Amazon, Overall

Herman Miller Aeron Chair

“The iconic [Aeron] is truly supportive and gives you every bit of adjustment to sit in an ideal way,” senior digital design editor Zoë Sessums said in her review of the legendary Herman Miller office chair. While buyers shopping through Herman Miller can experience a virtual fitting with an ergonomic expert, the Amazon experience is perfect for someone who knows what they want and offers speedy delivery to Prime members looking to upgrade their office setup in a jiffy. Stand-out features Sessums noted includes the patented PostureFit SL back support, which facilitated optimal working posture: chest open, shoulders back, and pelvis tilted slightly forward. “This chair will save your body. It isn’t necessarily the chicest piece of furniture, but your entire body will thank you, so in that case I would recommend the Aeron chair again and again,” says Sessums.

A Stylish, Streamlined Option

Branch Ergonomic Chair

Our contributor Terri Williams once told us that this Branch office chair “looks as good as it feels.” And we think it looks pretty great with its clean lines that give the design a streamlined look. Williams also praised the chair for its slim profile, synchronous tilt, and adjustable lumbar support that make the seat suitable for long working hours. If you’re in the market for an upgrade, the more advanced Branch Ergonomic Chair Pro received high praise from the AD shopping team for its adjustability and looks. (However, you’ll have to buy directly through Branch’s website for that model.)

Easiest Assembly

Haworth Breck Office Chair

The Breck chair’s easy assembly and breathable upholstery make it a top-tier choice for building an optimal home office. “What stands out the most to me are all the adjustable features that allow you to customize the seat to your exact preferences,” says commerce editor Audrey Lee. “Need more tilt? No problem. Wish the armrests were just a tad longer? Easy. Height? Seat depth? Lumbar support? Done, done, and done.” Stylistically, the chair has a minimal look, but it’s available in unexpected colorways like an agave-inspired green and blush pink to add some personality to what can feel like an otherwise sterile desk accessory.

Most Lumbar Support

Vari Task Chair

This Vari design is another model you might recognize from our main list of the best ergonomic office chairs. “This chair is ridiculously comfortable—it has a super-thick foam seat and highly breathable back with great airflow,” Williams says. “The backrest provides lumbar support and I like that I can also create the maximum level of comfort.” The chair is also equipped with an adjustable tilt mechanism, adjustable armrests, and adjustable seat height that can be set to your specific preference. We also recommend checking out their suburb lineup of standing desks that can fit home offices of all sizes.

An Internet Favorite Pick

Misolant Ergonomic Office Chair

A hidden footrest gives this TikTok-famous pick some star quality. Reviewers say that the chair has great back support and appreciate the design is easy to assemble. At under $150, it’s also a great budget option for anyone looking to experiment with finding the right seating situation for work from home days.

Best Budget Pick

Flexispot OC3B Chair

Flexispot’s OC3B is one of our favorite desk chairs sold on Amazon. According to AD tester Terri Williams, it’s the “best of both worlds” when it comes to comfort and price point. “The entire chair (backrest, seat, headrest) is made of breathable mesh, which contributes to air circulation,” she writes, and it has “several adjustment points, plus a clothes hanger on the back to keep a jacket or throw blanket close by.” To top it all off, it’s just plain comfortable for sitting in hour after hour. Though you are trying to take more breaks, right?

More Office Chairs We Recommend

Neo Chair Office and Gaming Chair

For those who want comfort but find themselves on a tight budget, here’s a supportive, under-$75 option that’ll arrive in just two days. A breathable mesh design means you won’t get sweaty while plowing through spreadsheets or fighting digital enemies, and the 15-minute assembly process isn’t bad either.

SIHOO M18 Ergonomic Office Chair

Sihoo’s popular ergonomic mesh office chair combines affordability and quality. You’ll get a padded headrest, adjustable lumbar support, and a contoured cushion—all with a lifetime warranty. Reviewers say this is an especially great pick for “big and tall” folks, since you can adjust the seat and headrest heights a great deal and the seat itself is roomy.

Branch Verve Chair

Branch makes high-quality, comfortable office chairs at middle-of-the-road price points. An adjustable lumbar rest and a contoured backrest will help keep you feeling fresh, even if you’re stuck at your desk for hours. Not only does this chair swivel, it tilts, it’s height-adjustable, and you can tweak the seat depth.

Branch Daily Chair

The Daily Chair is a Goldilocks office chair that has everything you need (adjustable height and armrests, plush cushions, and easy-to-maneuver wheels) and nothing you don’t. It offers plenty of spinal and lumbar support for long hours perched at your desk, plus it comes in pleasing hues like mahogany and sky blue besides your standard neutral gray and black.

Steelcase Gesture Office Chair

The Steelcase Gesture may be quite expensive for an office chair—$1,600 is no small chunk of change—but if you’re looking to splurge on one of the most comfortable chairs you’ll ever sit in, it’s absolutely worth the price. The Gesture strikes the perfect balance between plush and firm, providing back support for long days at your desk alongside a thick, comfortable seat that holds up to years of punishment. There are three recline positions to let you fine-tune your position throughout the day, and the intuitive adjustment mechanisms make it easy to move things around without any fuss.

Steelcase Series 1 Office Chair

The Steelcase Series 1 uses your body weight to automatically adjust back and lumbar support when you sit down, meaning you don’t have to fuss with buttons or levers to get the right fit, something we have found to be tricky with cheaper chairs. The Series 1 is also wildly customizable, with the option to add a headrest, your choice of carpet or hardwood wheels, and seemingly endless color options (such as neon orange and lemon yellow) for the maximalist home office. No matter what type of space you’re working with, there’s a Series 1 we think will work for you.

Herman Miller Embody Ergonomic Office Chair

It’s not entirely surprising that the midcentury specialists at Herman Miller have optimized an all-around ergonomic office chair, the Embody. The tapered back panel takes cues from the human body, with a central spine to keep things stable and flexible ribs for comfort. In fact, the brand collaborated with over 20 physicians and doctors in biomechanics, vision, physical therapy, and ergonomics to perfect this chair.

Steelcase Leap Office Chair

Thanks to 3D LiveBack technology, Steelcase’s Leap can align itself to the shape of your spine, using seven points of adjustment to perfectly cradle your back during long days parked in front of the screen. The Natural Glide seat moves forward and back as you recline, keeping you in the optimal seated position whether you’re trying to relax or want to sit up straight and dig in.

Zesthouse Modern Cane Office Chair

If you haven’t yet scored a vintage Breuer model, here’s a cane-back office chair in a similar midcentury style. The seat is topped with a tufted, faux-leather cushion, which one reviewer describes as “thick,” “not too shiny,” and “luxurious.” (And unlike genuine leather, it’ll be easy to keep clean.)

Amazon Basics Low-Back Mesh Desk Chair

Not everyone is a fan of armchairs—sometimes they actually just get in the way. If you really want to get back to basics, here’s an option from the retailer itself—that just may be the most-reviewed office chair on the site. The two-inch-thick seat cushion will provide ample support, and the contoured mesh back will bend to your weight, unlike rigid models made from leather or upholstery. (If you’re not yet persuaded, you could always read some of the nearly 14,000 five-star reviews.)

FAQs

Why is it important to get a high-quality office chair?

A high-quality chair will pay for itself in a handful of ways. First, it’ll last longer than ones that are constructed poorly, in the hopes that you’ll be able to use it for years and years before replacing. Second, high-quality chairs usually have more cushioning, more thoughtful construction, and more points of adjustment—all of which are important for your physical health, especially if you plan on sitting on your task chair for eight hours a day. “A proper fitting desk chair is one of the cornerstones of postural health,” neurosurgeon Betsy Grunch, MD, FAANS, FACS previously told Clever. “People who sit for long hours in a poorly adjusted chair will experience neck, back, shoulder, and hip pain. This can trigger headaches, lack of concentration and compression of the discs in the spine.”

What does “ergonomic” even mean?

You’ve definitely heard of the word ergonomic, but it can be tough figuring out exactly what that means for your home office chairs. “A chair that is coined ergonomic should offer firmness that is supportive yet comfortable,” Kristy Basinger PT, CHT, previously told us. “It should have multiple components that adjust all aspects of the chair. Adjustments are important because we all have different body types and heights.” Using adjustable components so that your chair fits your body (and not the other way around) keeps your spine in a healthy position, which reduces the risk of hurting your back or neck.

What should you look for in an office chair?

Every chair feels a little bit different for every single person. There are a few things to keep in mind when you’re looking for a comfy chair that isn’t going to cause you any pain now or in the future.

  • Look for something adjustable: The beauty here is that you have some literal wiggle room if something feels a bit off. Set yourself up for success by looking into options with an adjustable headrest, adjustable armrests, a seat height with a bit of range, etc.
  • Pay close attention to where there is support: Some chairs have fuller seat cushions made of a high-density material and others offer a bit of recline. You know your body best, so take the time to figure out where your pain areas are and where you need an extra bit of support. In general, chairs with lumbar support are always a good place to start.
  • Check the warranty and return policy: In general, furniture items shipped by Amazon (or that are Prime eligible) are returnable for any reason within 30 days of receipt of shipment. This especially comes in handy when you’re buying a desk chair sight unseen. (Some items that aren’t shipped by Amazon may be subject to the vendor’s own return policy, so be sure to read the fine print.) If you’re worried about durability, most vendors offer free warranties—meaning they’ll replace your chair if it falls apart—even several years after your purchase.
